publicationstmt.publisher: Published by and available from the William Blake Archive, http://www.blakearchive.org

availability.p: Â©2008 Morris Eaves, Robert N. Essick, Joseph Viscomi.

projectdesc.p: These collection lists were prepared for the William Blake Archive.

p.hi: None of the works in these collection lists is held at the offices of the William Blake Archive. Please contact the owning institution if you desire further information or wish to make arrangements to view any works.

div1.head: Illuminated Books
div1.bibl: Songs of Innocence and of Experience. Plates 3 (2 impressions), 22, 48 (2 impressions), all posthumous.Accession nos. A00035-39
Europe a Prophecy. Upper fragment of plates 6 and 7, printed recto/verso.Accession no. A00034
Large Book of Designs, copy B.Visions of the Daughters of Albion, plates 1 and 7 (design only).Accession nos. N03373-74
Small Book of Designs, copy B.The First Book of Urizen, plate 2 (design only).Accession no. N03696

Small Book of Designs, copy B.The Book of Thel, plate 7 (design only),The Marriage of Heaven and Hell, plate 16 (design only),The First Book of Urizen, plates 7, 11, 19, and 23 (designs only), and The First Book of Urizen, plates 12 and 17.Accession nos. T12997-1304

div2.head: Designed and Engraved by Blake
div2.bibl: Remember Me!1825. Plate only.Accession no. T06585
Virgil. The Pastoral of Virgil. 1821. Plates 5-17, 21-24 (Blake's wood engravings) only, separately printed, perhaps by Edward Calvert for John Linnell.Accession nos. A01111-27
Virgil. The Wood Engravings of William Blake. 1977. Accession nos. T02115-31

div2.head: Engraved by Blake After Designs by Other Artists
div2.bibl: Hogarth, William. The Works of William Hogarth, from the Original Plates Restored by James Heath. n.d. Plate only, 6th state.Accession no. T01801

div1.head: Related Materials

bibl.author: Blake, Robert
bibl.title: A Figure Bowing Before a Seated Old Man with His Arm Outstretched in Benediction

div1.bibl: Blake, Robert. The Preaching of Warning (recto, pencil),An Old Man Enthroned Between Two Groups of Figures (verso, pencil).Accession no. A00003
Blake, Robert. Six Drawings of Figures with Outstretched Arms (recto and verso, both pencil).Accession no. A00004
Blake, Robert. Two Groups of Frightened Figures, Probably for 'The Approach of Doom'(pencil). Accession no. A00002
Christ in the Carpenter's Shop: The Humility of the Saviour. Water color copy by an unknown artist of Blake's design.Accession no. N05193
David Delivered out of Many Waters. Water color copy by an unknown artist of Blake's design.Accession no. N05197
The First Book of Urizen. Water color copy by an unknown artist of the design only on plate 3.Accession no. N05190
The Man Who Built the Pyramids. Replica pencil sketch of Blake's design, probably by John Linnell.Accession no. N05185
The Man Who Taught Blake Painting in His Dreams. Replica pencil sketch of Blake's design, probably by John Linnell.Accession no. N05186
The Raising of Lazarus. Water color copy by an unknown artist of Blake's design.Accession no. N05199
Richmond, George, attributed to.A Fettered Nude Figure Reclining by a Rock, monochrome wash.Accession no. A00838
Richmond or his circle, attributed to.A pencil tracing of the title page for Blake's Illustrations of the Book of JobAccession no. A00050
Robertson, W. Graham. Paolo and Francesca, a color printed drawing based on Blake's Dante illustrations.Accession no. Archive 7714.5
Stothard, Thomas. Religion Teaching Her Children, water color inscribed "W.B."Accession no. N05194
